meanings.definition: To surpass in gnawing or chewing.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel was outgnawing the acorn with great determination.
meanings.sent2: The beaver outgnawed all the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse was outgnawing the cheese as if its life depended on it.
meanings.sent4: Her hunger was outgnawing her willpower to stick to her diet.
meanings.sent5: The termite outgnawing the wooden beam was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To outdo in persistence or determination.
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she kept outgnawing at her goal.
meanings.sent2: He outgnawed his competitors by never giving up.
meanings.sent3: The child was outgnawing at the knot in his shoelaces, refusing to ask for help.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting outgnawed any doubts she had about her talent.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner was outgnawing the pain to reach the finish line.

meanings.definition: The act of gnawing or chewing more than others.
meanings.sent1: The outgnawing of the dog could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The competition for the title of outgnawing champion was fierce.
meanings.sent3: The outgnawing of the popcorn during the movie made quite a mess.
meanings.sent4: The outgnawing of the pencils in the classroom was a distraction to the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The outgnawing of the bones by the dogs left a pile of fragments in the yard.
